plugin.comment: note: only the flood combat forms will ever try to switch movement types voluntarily during combat

enum16.name: movement type#when we have a choice of movement types, which type we will use

float32.name: initial crouch chance
float32.description: actors that start their movement try to maintain this fraction of crouched actors

float32.name: crouch time
float32.description: when switching movement types, how long we will stay crouched for before running min

float32.name: crouch time
float32.description: when switching movement types, how long we will stay crouched for before running max

float32.name: run time
float32.description: when switching movement types, how long we will run for before slowing to a crouch min

float32.name: run time
float32.description: when switching movement types, how long we will run for before slowing to a crouch max

float32.name: maximum firing distance
float32.description: we can only fire our weapon at targets within this distance

float32.name: rate of fire
float32.description: how many times per second we pull the trigger (zero = continuously held down)

degree.name: projectile error
degree.description: error added to every projectile we fire

float32.name: first burst delay time
float32.description: seconds min

float32.name: first burst delay time
float32.description: seconds max

float32.name: desired combat range
float32.description: world units min

float32.name: desired combat range
float32.description: world units max

float32.name: custom stand gun offset
float32.description: custom standing gun offset for overriding the default in the base actor i

float32.name: custom stand gun offset
float32.description: custom standing gun offset for overriding the default in the base actor j

float32.name: custom stand gun offset
float32.description: custom standing gun offset for overriding the default in the base actor k

float32.name: custom crouch gun offset
float32.description: custom crouching gun offset for overriding the default in the base actor i

float32.name: custom crouch gun offset
float32.description: custom crouching gun offset for overriding the default in the base actor j

float32.name: custom crouch gun offset
float32.description: custom crouching gun offset for overriding the default in the base actor k

float32.name: target tracking
float32.description: how well our bursts track moving targets. 0.0= fire at the position they were standing when we started the burst. 1.0= fire at current position

float32.name: target leading
float32.description: how much we lead moving targets. 0.0= no prediction. 1.0= predict completely.

float32.name: weapon damage modifier
float32.description: what fraction of its normal damage our weapon inflicts (zero = no modifier)

float32.name: damage per second
float32.description: only used if weapon damage modifier is zero... how much damage we should deliver to the target per second while firing a burst at them (zero = use weapon default)

plugin.comment:
at the start of every burst we pick a random point near the target to fire at, on either the left or the right side. the burst origin angle controls whether this error is exactly horizontal or might have some vertical component.
over the course of the burst we move our projectiles back in the opposite direction towards the target. this return motion is also controlled by an angle that specifies how close to the horizontal it is.
for example if the burst origin angle and the burst return angle were both zero, and the return length was the same as the burst length, every burst would start the same amount away from the target (on either the left or right) and move back to exactly over the target at the end of the burst.

float32.name: burst origin radius
float32.description: how far away from the target the starting point is

degree.name: burst origin angle
degree.description: the range from the horizontal that our starting error can be

float32.name: burst return length
float32.description: how far the burst point moves back towards the target (could be negative) min

float32.name: burst return length
float32.description: how far the burst point moves back towards the target (could be negative) max

degree.name: burst return angle
degree.description: the range from the horizontal that the return direction can be

float32.name: burst duration
float32.description: how long each burst we fire is min

float32.name: burst duration
float32.description: how long each burst we fire is max

float32.name: burst separation
float32.description: how long we wait between bursts min

float32.name: burst separation
float32.description: how long we wait between bursts max

degree.name: burst angular velocity
degree.description: the maximum rate at which we can sweep our fire (zero = unlimited)

float32.name: special damage modifier
float32.description: damage modifier for special weapon fire (applied in addition to the normal damage modifier. zero = no change)

degree.name: special projectile error
degree.description: projectile error angle for special weapon fire (applied in addition to the normal error)

plugin.comment:
a firing pattern lets you modify the properties of an actor's burst geometry. actors choose which firing pattern to use based on their current state: 'new-target' when the target just appeared 'moving' when the actor is moving 'berserk' if the actor is berserk if none of these apply, no firing pattern is used.
the default values in the burst geometry are multiplied by any non-zero modifiers in the firing pattern.

float32.name: new-target burst duration
float32.description: burst duration multiplier for newly appeared targets (zero = unchanged)

float32.name: new-target burst separation
float32.description: burst separation multiplier for newly appeared targets (zero = unchanged)

float32.name: new-target rate of fire
float32.description: rate-of-fire multiplier for newly appeared targets (zero = unchanged)

float32.name: new-target projectile error
float32.description: error multiplier for newly appeared targets (zero = unchanged)

float32.name: moving burst duration
float32.description: burst duration multiplier when the actor is moving (zero = unchanged)

float32.name: moving burst separation
float32.description: burst separation multiplier when the actor is moving (zero = unchanged)

float32.name: moving rate of fire
float32.description: rate-of-fire multiplier when the actor is moving (zero = unchanged)

float32.name: moving projectile error
float32.description: error multiplier when the actor is moving (zero = unchanged)

float32.name: berserk burst duration
float32.description: burst duration multiplier when the actor is berserk (zero = unchanged)

float32.name: berserk burst separation
float32.description: burst separation multiplier when the actor is berserk (zero = unchanged)

float32.name: berserk rate of fire
float32.description: rate-of-fire multiplier when the actor is berserk (zero = unchanged)

float32.name: berserk projectile error
float32.description: error multiplier when the actor is berserk (zero = unchanged)

float32.name: super-ballistic range
float32.description: we try to aim our shots super-ballistically if target is outside this range (zero = never)

float32.name: bombardment range
float32.description: we offset our burst targets randomly by this range when firing at non-visible enemies (zero = never)

float32.name: modified vision range
float32.description: any custom vision range that this actor variant has (zero = normal)

enum16.name: special-fire mode#the type of special weapon fire that we can use
special-fire situation#when we will decide to use our special weapon fire mode

float32.name: special-fire chance
float32.description: how likely we are to use our special weapon fire mode

float32.name: special-fire delay
float32.description: how long we must wait between uses of our special weapon fire mode

float32.name: melee range
float32.description: how close an enemy target must get before triggering a melee charge

float32.name: melee abort range
float32.description: if our target gets this far away from us, we stop trying to melee them

float32.name: berserk firing ranges
float32.description: if we are outside maximum range, we advance towards target, stopping when we reach minimum range min

float32.name: berserk firing ranges
float32.description: if we are outside maximum range, we advance towards target, stopping when we reach minimum range max

float32.name: berserk melee range
float32.description: while berserking, how close an enemy target must get before triggering a melee charge

float32.name: berserk melee abort range
float32.description: while berserking, if our target gets this far away from us, we stop trying to melee them

enum16.name: grenade type#type of grenades that we throw
trajectory type#how we throw our grenades
grenade stimulus#what causes us to consider throwing a grenade

int16.name: minimum enemy count
int16.description: how many enemies must be within the radius of the grenade before we will consider throwing there

float32.name: enemy radius
float32.description: we consider enemies within this radius when determining where to throw

float32.name: grenade velocity
float32.description: how fast we can throw our grenades

float32.name: grenade ranges
float32.description: ranges within which we will consider throwing a grenade min

float32.name: grenade ranges
float32.description: ranges within which we will consider throwing a grenade max

float32.name: collateral damage radius
float32.description: we won't throw if there are friendlies around our target within this range

float32.name: grenade chance
float32.description: how likely we are to throw a grenade

float32.name: grenade check time
float32.description: for continuous stimuli (e.g. visible target), how often we check to see if we want to throw a grenade

float32.name: encounter grenade timeout
float32.description: we cannot throw grenades if someone else in our encounter threw one this recently

tagRef.name: equipment
tagRef.description: equipment item to drop when we die

uint16.name: grenade count
uint16.description: number of grenades that we start with min

uint16.name: grenade count
uint16.description: number of grenades that we start with max

float32.name: dont drop grenades chance
float32.description: how likely we are not to drop any grenades when we die, even if we still have some

float32.name: drop weapon loaded
float32.description: amount of ammo loaded into the weapon that we drop (in fractions of a clip, e.g. 0.3 to 0.5) min

float32.name: drop weapon loaded
float32.description: amount of ammo loaded into the weapon that we drop (in fractions of a clip, e.g. 0.3 to 0.5) max

uint16.name: drop weapon ammo
uint16.description: total number of rounds in the weapon that we drop (ignored for energy weapons) min

uint16.name: drop weapon ammo
uint16.description: total number of rounds in the weapon that we drop (ignored for energy weapons) max

float32.name: body vitality
float32.description: maximum body vitality of our unit

float32.name: shield vitality
float32.description: maximum shield vitality of our unit

float32.name: shield sapping radius
float32.description: how far away we can drain the player's shields

int16.name: forced shader permutation
int16.description: if nonzero, overrides the unit's shader permutation
